mapped_songs.comment_text:
About ten years ago, I was living in Dublin. One particularly rainy day, I picked up some meds for a sick friend and headed to their place in a taxi. The driver, a black fellow with a thick African accent, greeted me with a massive smile, asked me how I was, and when I asked him back he replied with "I'm doing great mate, it's a beautiful day". At that point, some random song was playing on the radio, but when it switched to Beautiful Day, that guy's smile got even wider and he looked at me, saying "See mate? I told you, it's a beautiful day", drumming on his steering wheel to the rhythm all the way.

It's one of those moments I go back to when I feel really down and need a pick me up.
mapped_songs.ananki_reasoning: This story beautifully captures the essence of finding joy and positivity in ordinary circumstances. I'm in my late 70's. I remember when this song was released. My girlfriend and I danced and danced to this song. We loved it. I am still dancing, only alone now. I wish you all the best. Please stay well and keep in touch.
Dec. 25, 2022: Just want to wish all of you nice people Happy Holidays and to thank you for the nice notes you send me. You are the best. Stay well and let us keep on dancing. I plan to give all of you a New Year's eve toast while I am dancing to "Wake Me Up Before You Go".
Hugs to all of you.
June 8, 2024: Last night they had a dance at the club house and played music from the 60's and 70's and they played "Wake me Up Before you Go Go"... I thought I have to let my friends on YouTube know about this.... Of course I danced with a nice young lady who made my evening even greater. üòâ Hope all is well with all of you. XX

mapped_songs.post_title: Happy songs to make you smile!
mapped_songs.comment_text:
As I've really been struggling with self esteem, self worth, depression, anxiety and have been feeling super low lately, finding this song on my morning commute on the train - it means so much to me! I'm trying as hard as I can to not cry on the train as all of these feelings are suddenly welling up unexpectedly! 

I've always been a Mraz fan, but in this long term rut of depression I've forgotten a lot of what makes me happy. I'm setting this as my morning alarm song to remind me that I can and deserve to be happy. <3 

I really doubt you'll ever see this, Jason, but in the very slim chance you do: thank you! You'll probably never know how much of a difference you've made for me. <3 

As I'm writing this, I've suddenly realized that, in this long term depression, I'd forgotten about "The Remedy" and that means way more to me now than it ever did in the past
mapped_songs.ananki_reasoning: The commenter is struggling with depression, low self-esteem, and anxiety, but this song unexpectedly brought up powerful positive emotions during their morning commute - so much so that they're fighting back tears of relief/joy. They're setting it as their morning alarm specifically as a reminder of hope and capability ('remind me that I can'). This is a quintessential 'Feel Good' moment - a song that lifts spirits during dark times, provides emotional comfort, and serves as a daily motivational anchor. While it could be 'Sunshine' or 'Carefree,' the deeper therapeutic purpose and the emotional weight of rediscovering happiness through music during a depression makes this solidly 'Feel Good' rather than purely lighthearted vibes.
